item.description:
The summer series at the WH Main Library focuses on the War of Northern Aggression, also called The War Between the States or the American Civil War. Each Thursday in July view a different movie.

JULY 1 - GETTYSBURG (PART 1) 2 hrs. 22min.
JULY 8 - GETTYSBURG (PART 2) 1 hr. 52min.
Tom Berenger, Martin Sheen, Jeff Daniels, Sam Elliott, Richard Jordan, C. Thomas Howell; Turner Pictures; Directed by Ronald F. Maxwell
Rated PG; 1993 - Based on Michael Shaara's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel, 'The Killer Angels,' GETTYSBURG dramatically depicts the three most courageous days in American history as experienced by the leaders of the Confederate and Union armies. With painstaking attention to detail and utilizing one of the largest scale period motion-picture sequences in history.


All films start at 5:15PM sharp in the Library Meeting Room, Noah Webster Library, 20 S. Main St.
Park in the Isham Garage and bring your parking ticket to the library for validation.
Enjoy the films with your own covered beverage or quiet snack.
Note that the movie may not take up the entire assigned time. We can go out after the movie, many restaurants in the area will be open afterwards.
COST: FREE

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: WH Library Summer Series - CIVIL WAR - Gettysburg (Part 1)
